As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions, but there are several alternative ways to handle conflicts besides resorting to violence and oppression. 

1. Dialogue and negotiation: One of the most effective ways to resolve conflicts is through dialogue and negotiation. This involves bringing all parties together to discuss their concerns and interests and finding common ground. The key to successful negotiation is that all parties should be willing to compromise and find a mutually acceptable solution.

2. Mediation: When direct dialogue between parties is not possible, a third party mediator can help facilitate communication and negotiation. Mediators act as neutral facilitators who encourage communication and trust-building between parties, helping them to identify mutually acceptable solutions.

3. Conflict resolution strategies: There are various conflict resolution strategies that can be employed to help resolve disputes. These include problem-solving workshops, community dialogues, and restorative justice approaches. The goal of these strategies is to create safe spaces and bring stakeholders together to develop a shared understanding of the conflict and work towards a mutually agreeable solution.

4. Nonviolent resistance: Nonviolent resistance involves using peaceful means to protest, demonstrate, and resist oppression. This can include civil disobedience, peaceful protests, and other forms of nonviolent action. Nonviolent resistance is grounded in the belief that violence only begets violence, and that peaceful means can be more effective in bringing about social and political change.

Overall, there are many alternatives to violence and oppression when resolving conflicts. These approaches require collaboration, trust-building, and a willingness to listen and compromise. Effective conflict resolution involves understanding different perspectives and interests and working together to find common ground and build sustainable peace.
